lcpb.general.saveTestCases.title: Save fetched testcases
lcpb.general.saveTestCases.description: Save fetched testcases to a file.

lcpb.general.testcaseSaveLocation.title: Path of the directory in which you want to save the fetched testcases
lcpb.general.testcaseSaveLocation.description:
Location where you want to save your files. Example '/home/user/leetcode'
This is used only if 'Save fetched testcases' is enabled.
(default: working_directory\.lcpb\testcases)

lcpb.general.problemSaveLocation.title: Path of the directory in which you want to save the fetched problem
lcpb.general.problemSaveLocation.description:
LCPB saves problem state in this directory. It helps to restore the webview state on the event that editor is closer or switched. Example '/home/user/lcpb_prb_states'
(default: working_directory\.lcpb\problems)

lcpb.general.templateFileLocationCpp.title: Path of the C++ template file for leetcode problems
lcpb.general.templateFileLocationCpp.description:
Location of the template file.
Warning: This will be added on top of the classes predefined by the LeetCode Problem which is being fetched. Exclude main function from the template or you may get compilation error.
Example '/home/user/template.cpp'

lcpb.general.templateFileLocationPython.title: Path of the python template file for leetcode problems
lcpb.general.templateFileLocationPython.description:
Location of the template file.
Warning: This will be added on top of the classes predefined by the LeetCode Problem which is being fetched.
Example '/home/user/template.py'

lcpb.language.cpp.Args.title: Compilation flags for C++ files
lcpb.language.cpp.Args.description: Space seperated additional flags passed to g++ ( for C++ ) while compiling your file. Example '-Wmaybe-uninitialized -std=c++14'

lcpb.language.cpp.Command.description: Command used to compile .cpp files. Example 'g++', 'g++-10', 'clang++', etc.

lcpb.language.python.Args.title: Compilation flags for Python files
lcpb.language.python.Args.description: Space seperated additional flags passed to python while compiling your file. Example '-Wignore -u'

lcpb.language.python.Command.description: Command used to run python files. Example 'py', 'python3', 'pypy3', etc.

scripts.build: npm run build:extension && npm run build:webview
scripts.pretest: npm run compile-tests && npm run compile && npm run lint
